publicwhip.spmotion: S3M-4601 John Wilson: £7.1 Million Investment in New Materials Recycling Facility at Bargeddie, Lanarkshire—That the Parliament welcomes the shift in focus from waste to resource reuse; recognises the importance of recycling in diverting 95% of household resources from landfill by 2020; notes the necessity of investment in the green jigsaw of recycling infrastructure, such as the £7.1 million investment at Viridor’s Materials Recycling Facility in Bargeddie, Lanarkshire; further notes the benefits of green jobs for communities and the creation of 19 new positions at the new recycling facility, and calls on the Scottish Government to continue its support for ongoing investment in zero waste technologies. Supported by: Christina McKelvie, Mike Pringle, Gil Paterson, Bill Kidd, Sandra White
S3M-4601 £7.1 Million Investment in New Materials Recycling Facility at Bargeddie, Lanarkshire (lodged on 15 July 2009) Jamie Hepburn*
